Class TetrisBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • TetrisBoard

  • public class TetrisBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Create a tetris board on which tetris is played. The board maintains the grid and handles the logic of the tetris pieces on it

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TetrisBoard()
      Create a Tetris Board

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNewPiece()
      Add a new piece to the board; the piece is in random shape
      Block[][] getBlockMatrix()
      Get the tetris board
      TetrisPiece getCurrentPiece()
      Get the current piece in the board
      int[] getCurrentPieceGP()
      Get the current position of the current piece in the board
      TetrisPiece getNextPiece()
      Get the next tetris piece
      int getNumCols()
      Get the number of columns in the board
      int getNumRows()
      Get the number of rows in the board
      boolean hasBlock(int row, int col)
      Check whether an entry in the tetris board has a block or a piece on top of it
      boolean isOver()
      Check whether the game is over
      void landPiece()
      Land the piece when it cannot move down any more
      boolean moveDown()
      Move the piece down
      boolean moveLeft()
      Move the piece to the left
      boolean moveRight()
      Move the piece to the right
      int numberOfClearedLines()
      Calculate the number of cleared lines in the board
      boolean rotateCCW()
      Rotate the piece counter-clockwise
      boolean rotateCW()
      Rotate the piece clockwise

      • hasBlock

        public boolean hasBlock(int row,
                        int col)
        Check whether an entry in the tetris board has a block or a piece on top of it
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the entry to be checked
        col - the column of the entry to be checked
        Returns:
        true if there is a block, false otherwise
